column5: Took my son on the big tuna yak a few weeks back for some perch fun.   It was slightly choppy so we decided to stay close to shore to play it safe, around the 8 feet mark.  this depth worked out well.   Lots of little dinks caught but we got a few delicious keepers for some perch tacos for dinner.   I dont usually keep fish but simcoe perch are hard to resist!
Nothing beats quality time with the kids
Good on your for getting the young lad out. And your right, Simcoe perch are hard to beat for a feed of fish.
Your so right Bruce. Quality time with kids and grandkids is what its all about.
No better quality time with children than fishing and you can't beat some fresh Lake Simcoe perch! Great job!
